fields.description:
"Instance Health" detected a Collation problem with the following error message: The session collation of: 'GERMAN' is unsupported by JIRA

Each time JIRA opens a DB session on an Oracle DB the session does not take the nls_* parameters set in the DB or the DB schema but from informations it gets from the OS.
(i.e. set nls_sort=BINARY' on DB and and DB session will be changed within the session to nls_sort=GERMAN' just because the DB is installed on a German Windows2012)

In my opinion the language of the OS must not influence the DB session parameters.

Our selfmade solution is: 
Creating a session trigger on the DB which alters the parameter back to nls_sort=BINARY'

Please fix this bug or document it in the installation description.
fields.summary: DB session parameters depend on DB server OS language

h3. Problem Definition
Ability to create a Snapshot/baseline of JIRA at a certain point in time. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira should have feature that allows to create a snapshot type of backup for JIRA version, data, attachment and plugins that can be restored any time.
For example let say We are running in JIRA version 7.0, we should able to create snapshot backup and when we are in version 7.1 we should be able to restore that snapshot backup so that we can run back in version 7.0 with all the plugins and attachment that was included in JIRA 7.0.

  {panel}

h3. Summary


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Issue Navigator > Advanced
# JQL: created <= 2016-05-04
# Check the result, it does not include the issues created on 2016-05-04
# Same thing goes for "updated" and "resolved".

h3. Expected Results
Issues created/updated/resolved on the date stated should be shown.

h3. Actual Results
Only  issues created/updated/resolved on days before the date stated are shown.
 
h3. Notes
*  Custom date fields are not affected.
* Date 2016-05-04 means 2016-05-04 00:00:01 behind the scene, which explains why search returns now results. 

h3.Workaround
* Use a day after the desired date to show the issues.
* Use explicit time eg created <= '2016-05-0418:00'
fields.summary: System Date Fields Are Not Working Properly in JQL

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60871].
  {panel}

The documentation for [creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer] seems to have been copied from the [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Importing+data+from+CSV] document (using the JIRA Importers plugin).

However, there are several differences in functionality and behavior for using the CSV Importer vs the JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM). One example would be importing issues with Components or Labels - The JIRA Importer Plugin would create the missing entries for those fields, however, the CSV Importer will fail because the components / labels do not exist.

It would be great to have those differences documented (e.g. mentioned in the *Tips for importing CSV data into issue fields* section for each field).

Having a table / matrix with all the fields which can be imported and also how they differ on each imported would be the ideal.
fields.summary: explain differences btwn CSV importer and JIM plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60869].
  {panel}

First I'll ask the question, is there a reason all JVM options are going into JAVA_OPTS instead of being split up to also use CATALINA_OPTS?

The first reason for this is quite simply that Apache designed Tomcat servers this way as evidenced directly in the catalina.sh file.
The second reason is because having the heap settings in JAVA_OPTS while using a VMWare server dedicated strictly for a single JIRA application throws errors about insufficient memory when stopping the JVM.  
Since JAVA_OPTS are used on all calls (start, stop, run, debug), when calling for a JVM stop, it's also trying to initialize the heap again.  In our scenario, we set-up a dedicated VM server specifically for a large JIRA instance (10gb Heap).  It has been scaled accordingly for Server Memory and CPU.  Every time we restart the JVM it causes the system to dump a hs_err_pid.log file.  
This was never a problem when JIRA was being used on a shared server and the extra memory was available.

In short, with more teams moving to Virtual environments, this will be a problem that will continue grow.

I added a copy of what the setenv.sh file might look like.
fields.summary: Java Heap Settings and GC Logging should go into CATALINA_OPTS instead of JAVA_OPTS

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60861].
  {panel}

Project Category - Grouping of projects

Subcomponent - Splitting of a project into smaller manageable components

There is no ability in JIRA to search in a 'Project Category' for a 'subcomponent'

The search for subcomponent within a project is done in the following way (this exist today)

subcomponents("SUB", "Design", "true")

In subcomponents() JQL function you should define three parameters:
*+projectKey +*(String, mandatory)- key of the project to search in
*+componentName +*(String, mandatory) - name of the parent component in hierarchy
*+includeParentComponent +*(Boolean, optional, default=false) - include or skip issues for parent component name

What is needed
To be able to search a Project Category also and not just Project for componentName

Thanks,
Agnes
fields.summary: Subcomponent search in Project Category not available

fields.description:
h3. *Issue Summary*

When an issue is created and it has a security level added to it, users who are not members of the security level can still comment on the said issue if they know the issue key.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a security scheme and configure a security level {{admin}}
#* Associate some users with the security level. 
# Grant a user to have permission to set security permission.
# Have the user associate the security scheme with the project.
# Create a new issue and set the security level to the one in step 1.
# Note the Issue Key.
# Have a user (User B) who is not a member of the security level to send an email to the mail handler of the project.
#* User must have permission to add comments. 
#* Have issue key in the step above set as the header(title) of the email. 

h3. *Expected Behavior*
User B should not be able to comment in the issue as he does not belong to the security level.

h3. *Actual Behavior*
User B can comment in the issue despite the security level however he cannot view the issue in JIRA.
fields.summary: User able to comment in Issue which has a security level that he is not a member of

fields.description:

As per above, all the values are undefined.
This problem does not happen if you are releasing the version when your language is set to English (US or UK).

As I know in issue JRA-42923 this problem was resolved with other non-English languages, but still in JIRA 6.4.7. this problem appear when JIRA language is set to Latvian.
fields.summary: Cannot set version release date due to corrupted date picker when language is set to latvian

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60844].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
 * If a user customizes the session timeout as per [How to change the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+session+timeout], these changes are not reflected on the User Sessions page.
 * The session is not destroyed checking the atlassian-jira-security.log and the user does not get logged out , however on the User Sessions page, the session is removed and re-created automatically after 4 hours.
 * If the user is idle for more than 4 hours, the session disappears from the User Session page but does not get logged out.
 * The missing functionality is *not limited to a customized JIRA timeout, but also to standard JIRA session timeout*

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow the session in the User Session face to last as long as the time customized as per [How to change the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+session+timeout]

Related problem with Atlassian Bot Killer plugin - JRASERVER-70574
fields.summary: User session to respect the changes made to the session timeout customization

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way of having a report generated to calculate how long an issue was in a particular status. This will help to identify best performers and issues which do not follow the correct timeline of an issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement reports that could:
* Order issues by resolution time (to identify long running/complex ones)
* Order issues by users and times they took to solve issues assigned to them. 
* Order issues by projects to identify what not keeping up with project timeline/delaying the project.

h3. Workaround 
To utilise the tab *Transitions* when viewing an issue. However, this is only available issue by issue.
fields.summary: Implement report for tracking time in status in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
When JIRA is integrated with external user directory using Connector type, any username that have letter I with DOT above would not have its User Membership sync.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Integrate JIRA with an External directory using Connector.
# create a user in the directory which username(cn) have letter I with DOT above, such as "İSMAİL".
# Assign the User with a group(ou) in the External Directory.
# Let JIRA sync the User from the External Directory.

h3. Expected Result:
* The user is created with the group assigned to it.

h3. Actual Result:
* The user is created, but it is not assigned to any group.

Notes:
* Tested with Apache Directory Studio.
* Microsoft Active Directory have reported to have the same issue as well.
* http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0130/index.htm
fields.summary: User Membership is not sync if Username have letter I with DOT above.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60838].
  {panel}

On April 26, 2016, a feature has been added to JIRA Core that shows the summary, icon and status of an issue when referencing an issue in issue descriptions or comments (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-s-new-686863216.html). The extra space this occupies messes up the flow of some descriptions and comments.

Please add the possibility (preferably on a by-user basis) to:
* either disable this feature and simply show the issue key
* or only show the new feature as a mouseover title

It also appears to be so that the shown status is based on the board column, and not the actual _Status_, which can be confusing when working with multiple statuses in a single column.

Please add the possibility (preferably on a by-user basis) to:
* either disable the shown status (when it is not applicable)
* or show the actual _Status_ field instead

Affects JIRA Cloud 1000.5.0 released on April 26, 2016.
fields.summary: Add option to disable icon and status rendering in links to other issues

h3. Summary
The time unit used in application.xml file is shown as milliseconds (ms) instead of seconds (s)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a new [Support Zip|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Getting+Help#GettingHelp-CreatingaSupportZip]
# View the {{application-properties/application.xml}} file
# Note the _<services>_
{code:borderStyle=solid}
    <service>
      <name>Audit log cleaning service</name>
      <delay>86400ms</delay>
      <last-run>Today 9:13 AM</last-run>
    </service>
    <service>
      <name>Backup Service</name>
      <delay>43200ms</delay>
      <last-run>Today 9:13 AM</last-run>
    </service>
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The time unit should be seconds (s) 

h3. Actual Results
Time unit is shown as milliseconds (ms). Example:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
<delay>43200ms</delay>
{code}
 
h3. Notes
This does not affect any functionality within JIRA
fields.summary: Inaccurate time unit shown in application.xml

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60832].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As covered in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-s-new-686863216.html

as of the 26 APR 2016 update:
{quote}
Links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments) are now rendered with an icon and status, rather than as just a plain hyperlink.
{quote}

Current behavior is either All Wiki Style render enabled or disabled, and it would be nice as an administrator to be able to configure the renderer to use either the old format (Just the hyperlinked issue number) or the new format (with an icon and status).  If you type a correctly formatted issue key into any text field in JIRA, whether it uses wiki markup or not, it will present as a link to that issue. In wiki markup it will display as a jira issue macro with the summary and issue key, in default it just shows a hyperlink displayed as the issue number


h3. Suggested Solution
Add configuration option for field render behavior for issue number mapping

h3. Workaround
Using Wiki Renderer Text Formatting Notation to generate your own text based hyperlink as detailed here:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=links
{noformat}[http://<Instance_name>.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUEKEY-123]{noformat}
fields.summary: Links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments) are now rendered with an icon and status, rather than as just a plain hyperlink

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no notification being sent out when JIRA's heap size or DB connection pool is at the exhaustion state.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a custom field has been configured with multiple contexts, and issues exist in at least two of the contexts, the custom field will be split in the issue statistics gadget, if sorting by total. This does not affect natural sorting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a custom field with multiple contexts
# Create issues with the created custom field set to the same value across the contexts
# Create an issue statistics gadget that uses are filter covering the contexts
# Configure the issue statistics gadget to use sorting by Total

h3. Expected Results

The custom field is aggregated into a single line in the chart.

h3. Actual Results

The custom field is split into multiple lines in the chart, split by contexts.

h3.Workaround

Use "Natural" sorting for the issue statistics gadget.
fields.summary: Issue Statistics Gadget does not aggregate same custom field in different contexts when sorting by total

  {panel}

h5. Suggestion
Optionally use Bitbucket and/or Bitbucket Server to store attachments for JIRA. This would be especially beneficial for large files, with Git LFS that was recently introduced.

Through branch permissions and application links, permissions could be managed as well and many of the problems that currently exist in attachment handling in JIRA would be solved by this.

File versioning would also be solved by the basic concepts of SCM.
fields.summary: Use Bitbucket for attachment storage

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Issue summary
In JIRA 7.1.2 Issue Type icons are being added to the issue as an attachment when a user replies to the issue created email notification. This did not occur in JIRA 6.4.13 using same configuration.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create new JIRA instance
# Configure inbound and outbound mail server
# Create business project
# Add Create or Comment mail handler with settings noted below (default settings)
# Change user profile to notify of own changes
# Create issue in test project
# Reply to issue created notification
#* During testing reply sent from Microsoft Outlook
# Attachment will appear on issue when reply comment is added

Mail handler settings: 
{noformat}
Issue Type: Task 
Bulk: ignore
CC Assignee: true
CC Watchers: false
Create Users: false
Notify Users: true
Strip Quotes: false
{noformat}

h3. Expected behavior
Issue type image is not added at attachment. This is the behavior experienced in JIRA 6.4.13 using same mail handler settings.

h3. Note
This issue is related to the Microsoft Outlook client that is being used for replying the notification email from JIRA. It is tested with JIRA 7.x and Gmail to reply the notification email and the reply does not add any attachment. 

h3. Workarounds
# Remove the issue type icon from the email notification, as suggested by [~rnd42] in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60810?focusedCommentId=1887126&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1887126]. Tested on Jira 7.7
# Changing the properties of the issue type icon image, as suggested by [~mriedel1029065643] in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60810?focusedCommentId=1556728&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1556728].
fields.summary: Issue Type icon being attached to JIRA issue upon reply to issue notification

h3. Summary

When updating a custom fields description, it seems logical that this description would update every place that custom field is used. This is not the case.

h3. Environment

Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field
# Add a description to the field
# Add this custom field to a field configuration
# Update the description of the custom field on the custom fields page
# Look at the custom field on the field configuration


h3. Expected Results

The description of the custom field on the field configuration should be updated to match the changes made on the custom fields page

h3. Actual Results

The custom field description on the field configuration retains the original description if there is one.


h3.Workaround

The user will need to update the description of the respective field on the field configuration the field is being used on
fields.summary: Updating custom field description does not update field description on field configuration

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
A Number custom field in JIRA has type Numeric(18,6) in table *customfieldvalue* in the database (MS SQL). That means, it supports a maximum of 18 digits only, 12 before and 6 after the decimal point e.g. 111222333444.555666

However, when trying to enter a very big value e.g. 111222333444555666777888999, the field says it supports the maximum value of 100000000000000, which is 15 digits before the decimal point.

This is incorrect, as it exceeds the number of digits before the decimal point and there will be not enough space for the decimal digits. And the fact is, *the field doesn't accept a number which has more than 12 digits before the decimal point*.

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# create a Number custom field
# create an issue and enter the following value for the field: 111222333444555666777888999
# the field will say the maximum value allowed is 100000000000000
!number.png|thumbnail!
# now enter a different value with more than 12 and less than 15 digits before the decimal point e.g. 1000000000000 (13 digits)
# click Create

h4. +Expected behavior+
# JIRA should accept the value as it's less than the maximum value allowed
# The issue should be created with the Number value and indexed normally

h4. +Actual behavior+
# JIRA throws an error:
!create.png|thumbnail!
# The following error is seen in _JIRA_Home/log/atlassian-jira.log_:
{noformat}
2016-04-29 03:01:20,269 http-nio-8714-exec-17 ERROR admin 181x2025x1 54hyjn 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Error creating issue: 
com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:CustomFieldValue][parentkey,null][customfield,10101][issue,10039][id,10042][numbervalue,1.0E12] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO dbo.customfieldvalue (ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation))
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:588)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:494)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.create(DefaultIssueService.java:230)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.create(DefaultIssueService.java:199)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1330.invoke(Unknown Source)
	... 1 filtered
...
Caused by: java.sql.DataTruncation: Data truncation
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:386)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.nextToken(TdsCore.java:2421)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.getMoreResults(TdsCore.java:671)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.processResults(JtdsStatement.java:613)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeSQL(JtdsStatement.java:572)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(JtdsPreparedStatement.java:727)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:98)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:98)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeUpdate(SQLProcessor.java:673)
	... 259 more
{noformat}
# The issue is still created in JIRA without the Number value - this can be seen from the database:
!database.png|thumbnail!
(i) in my test, 39 issues are created but only 15 Number values are accepted
# However, the created issue is not indexed, so it's invisible from Issue Navigator and users might think it's not created at all:
!index.png|thumbnail!
(i) only the issues whose Number value is accepted are indexed

h4. +Notes+
# Re-indexing JIRA will make all the issues visible in Issue Navigator
# Only values up to 999999999999.999938 (12 digits before the decimal point) will be accepted and rounded up to 100000000000000 (13 digits), like the issue TEST-37 in [^index.png]. It's however stored as 999999999999.999880 (12 digits before the decimal point) in the database like in [^database.png].
# More than 6 decimal digits can be accepted (which is expected as they can be rounded)

h4. +Suggestion+
# The warning message about the maximum value allowed must be correct
# Values should be displayed exactly the same as they're stored in the database
fields.summary: Incorrect behavior of Number custom field

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# create a Single-line Text custom field
# create an issue and enter the following value for the field: 111222333444555666
# search for the issue in Issue Navigator and export to Excel
!issuenav.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Expected behavior+
The field is treated as text and displays 111222333444555666 correctly

h4. +Actual behavior+
The field is treated as number and displays an incorrect value:
!excel.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
# as per the screenshot, Number field is treated as number correctly, so Text field should be treated as text
# this may be related to Number field as:
#* Number field supports the maximum value of 100,000,000,000,000 (15 digits)
#* only the first 15 digits of the number in the Text field are retained (111,222,333,444,555) - the rest are converted to zeros
# Multi-line Text custom field is affected in the same way
fields.summary: Excel export converts text to number and fails to display the correct value

h3. Problem Definition
Allow Issue commented Event to be triggered when adding attachment and comment via Email instead of only issue updated event triggered.

h3. Suggested Solution
Currently In JIRA when an user add attachment via comment box in JIRA instance together with comment, at user end user receive notification for issue updated and issue commented notification as both of this event is triggered.

When an user reply JIRA email and add an attachment and comment in the mail. Attachment and comment is added to an issue but this time only event issue updated is triggered and issue comment is not triggered. As mentioned by developer note in this bug ticket [JRA-41226|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41226] it is an expected behaviour.

Kindly add feature in JIRA that allows issue commented and issue updated event to be triggered when an user reply JIRA email and add an attachment and comment in the mail.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 27 April 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa|titleColor=#FFFFFF} Hi Everyone,   Issue has been resolved in release 7.3.6 Server and will be shipped with 7.2.9 Server release soon. We decided to not apply suggestions which would involve introducing an index: we have changed user interface on group management page to prevent it from executing excessive amount of database queries. As a result - the Delete link is now always available for a group. Since now JIRA will verify whether the group is actually can be deleted only when user clicks the button. Should delete be not possible - JIRA will not execute the operation and show an information message for the administrator why the delete operation failed. This change now dramatically speeds up the page.   – Cheers, Ignat JIRA Bugmaster {panel}   h3. Summary Accessing *Admin (Cog)* > *User Management* > *Groups* can be slow for large JIRA instances (page url: {{secure/admin/user/GroupBrowser.jspa}}). In JIRA 7 new functionality was added and JIRA checks if group can be deleted, see example: !Non_delete.png|thumbnail! Related code from {{groupbrowser.jsp}}: {code:java}
  • " class="aui-button aui-button-link" href="javascript:void(0)" title="" aria-disabled="true" disabled>
    • {code} For each group from the list, method {{GroupBrowser.isGroupDeletable}} will be called. It does number of checks and as part of {{getCommentsAndWorklogsGuardedByGroupCount}} method it will generate following SQL query: {code:java} SELECT COUNT(A.ID) FROM public.jiraaction A WHERE A.actiontype='comment' AND A.actionlevel=''}} {code} An example in the SQL log would be ( time _1s_): {code:sql} 2016-04-27 13:51:22,470 http-nio-18714-exec-14 admin 831x1484x1 jcaucx /secure/admin/user/GroupBrowser.jspa 1083ms "SELECT COUNT(A.ID) FROM public.jiraaction A WHERE A.actiontype='comment' AND A.actionlevel='developers_9'" {code} There are no indexes that will enhance the performance of this query and as a result this query can take sometime to complete. h3. Environment Any database + JIRA 7 h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a JIRA instance with a large number of comments or jira 'actions'. You can use the [JIRA Data Generator|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-data-generator/server/overview] to help replicate this issue. # Enable SQL Logging from: *Admin (Cog)* > *System* > *Logging and Profiling* # Access the Groups page. # Observe the slow responsiveness of this page. h3. Expected Results JIRA should be responsive when accessing this page. h3. Actual Results The page can take some time to respond due to these queries being executed for each group that is displayed. h3. Notes Tracing the thread dumps shows a long-running thread such as: {noformat} ... at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.DefaultCommentManager.getCountForCommentsRestrictedByField(DefaultCommentManager.java:443) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.DefaultCommentManager.getCountForCommentsRestrictedByGroup(DefaultCommentManager.java:416) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.group.DefaultGroupService.getCommentsAndWorklogsGuardedByGroupCount(DefaultGroupService.java:824) at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.GroupBrowser.isGroupDeletable(GroupBrowser.java:233) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497) at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70) at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56) at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:517) at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:216) at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:62) at webwork.view.taglib.BasicPropertyTag.doStartTag(BasicPropertyTag.java:54) at jsp.secure.admin.user.views.groupbrowser_jsp._jspx_meth_ww_005fproperty_005f12(groupbrowser_jsp.java:3167) {noformat} h3. Workaround * Reduce the total number of Groups being returned by using a filter query. ** This can be achieved by accessing the Group Browser with the following *max* argument appended to the URL: {{/secure/admin/user/GroupBrowser.jspa?max=5}}
fields.summary: Group Management Page slow to respond in large JIRA instances

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary
When trying to edit an existing component to set a user with uppercase characters in their username as Component Lead for a JIRA Component, an error "The user <username> does not exist."

Users without uppercase characters in their username can be entered without problems. 
Selecting a user with uppercase characters in their username is possible when creating a new component. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud (JIRA v1000.5.0)
Works in JIRA Cloud v7.2.0-OD-03-005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the 'Project settings' menu for a JIRA project
# Click on the 'Components' link and then click on the ... button and select *edit* for an existing component. 
# Select a user (with uppercase characters in their username) from the drop down list, and then click Save. 

!Screen Shot 2016-04-27 at 1.20.31 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The user selected from the list is saved as the component lead

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed on screen (nothing appears in the logs):

!Screen Shot 2016-04-27 at 1.20.49 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
It is possible to edit the existing component using the REST API.
fields.summary: Unable to edit a component to set a user with uppercase characters in their username as Component Lead

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60773].
  {panel}

This search should return any items:

resolvedBy != "" and status was not in (resolved)

As an item that has never been resolved should not have a resolver. However, linked issues such as "relates to" and "clones" that have been resolved are populating this attribute.

This was noticed when the search: resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints()

began returning extra items the given users had not actually touched. This can inflate and give inaccurate figures which need to be rooted out by hand or filtered with something more like:

resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() and assignee was in (user1, user2, user3)

But this is also inaccurate as a true resolver does not necessarily possess the item when resolving.
fields.summary: resolvedBy is populating from linked issues

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to pass data like team and theme allocated to a story, from Portfolio to JIRA Agile.
h3. Suggested Solution
To have a configuration, example like Team and Theme to be passed to JIRA when creating and linking the issue.

h3. Use case
{quote}
There are various fields set in Portfolio - like Team and Theme for example.

We have added our own custom fields to JIRA for Team and Theme and we would like to set these values when the issue is created via Portfolio. We can already intercept the issue creation event in JIRA, but the data from Portfolio is not passed as part of the data received by JIRA.

Being able to expose Theme as a field in JIRA means we can then use our eazyBI plugin to do all sorts of useful analytics over our investment themes.

It also means that our business analysts don't need to manually keep 2 sets of data in sync.
{quote}
fields.summary: Passing team and theme from Portfolio to JIRA Agile

fields.description:
By default ubuntu includes following lines in /etc/hosts
{noformat}
127.0.0.1 localhost
127.0.1.1 fqn.host.name host.name
{noformat}
Later on ehcache  is configured using local hostname resolution which points to 127.0.1.1. 
Obviously 

*Workaround*
Remove line starting with 127.0.1.1 from /etc/hosts
Or make your host name point to external IP address

*Possible fix*
Caching replication should be configured using DNS CNAME resolution.
fields.summary: Automatic caching replication configuration for JIRA Data center is not working on default Ubuntu /etc/hosts configuration

h3. Summary

When querying {{/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/multiProjectSearch}}, it's possible to get an internal server error if the query parameters indicate to start at a higher number than the amount of users there are. For example if 24 users, and you try to startAt 25 it will fail.

h3. Expected Results

An empty set is returned.

h3. Actual Results

"Internal server error"
],
errors: { }
}

And an exception is thrown:

	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.scope.RequestScopeInterceptor.intercept(RequestScopeInterceptor.java:39)
	... 15 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:154)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:68)
	... 86 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.doFilter(JiraSecurityFilter.java:70)
	... 16 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:37)
	... 74 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60759].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Resolution Time Gadget's Y Axis is set to measure *Days*, and this cannot be configured. If an issue is created and resolved in less than a full day, it will be represented on this gadget with a resolution time that is rounded down to 0 days. 

If the following situation occurs:

# An issue is created and resolved in less than the span of a full day
# There are no other issues resolved on that day to raise the average of all issues to *at least* 1 day 

A confusing scenario will result where the chart shows no visible measurement for the day. You cannot discern if either no issues were resolved that day, or if there are issues but they average < 1 day. For example, in the screenshot below:

 !Resolution_Time_Gadget.png|thumbnail! 

Without expanding the gadget to view the data table, you cannot see that issues were resolved on 4/20/16 and 4/21/16.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
This could be addressed by allowing the Y axis measurement to be configured for more granularity; for example, by the *Hour* rather than by the *Day*.

h3. Workaround 
None; expand the data table to view specific data.
fields.summary: Resolution Time Gadget configure Y Axis measurement metric

h3. Summary
When searching for issues in the issue navigator, after clicking on any of the fields, for example projects, type, status or assignee, there is no focus on the search field that is displayed.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the issue navigator
# Click on any of the fields above (Status, Type, Assignee, Projects etc)
# Start typing immediately. 

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60752].
  {panel}

Hi JIRA team,

Let me introduce our problem:

We would like to take advantage of "Road map" feature in project. Found out that it is interconnected with "Fix Version/s" field.

We started to use "Fix Version/s" for marking build number (e.g. "6.1.23.0") to which the issues is fixed.
Atlassian help says this field should be used for marking mentioned, or future version to which we plan to fix this issue.

There are several build before a release is released. We may call the planned release something general like "Service Release 1 (SR1)". We plan to release SR1 let's say in Q3/2016.
 
This is where the problem lies. When we would like to take advantage of "Road Map", all "unreleased" versions are part of the roadmap. The roadmap will look as follows
* 6.1.23.0
* 6.1.24.0
* 6.1.25.0
* 6.1.26.0
* 6.1.27.0
* 6.1.28.0
* Service Release 1 (SR1)
* 6.1.29.0
* 6.1.30.0
* 6.1.31.0
* 6.1.32.0
* Service Release 2 (SR2)

Basically, we would like to be able to filter build numbers so roadmap looks as follows:
* Service Release 1 (SR1)
* Service Release 2 (SR2)

The released build for SR1 will be "6.1.28.0" (but we obviously do not know the build number upfront, we call it SR1)
The released build for SR2 will be "6.1.32.0"(but we obviously do not know the build number upfront, we call it SR1)

We understand, that we may be able to set build numbers "Release flag" and they will not be shown in "Road Map". But this is not true and we do not want to do that. These build numbers are just interim builds for testing that will never be released.

We also understand that we may "Archive" the version. But we do not want to do that as well as archived versions cannot be searched for using Basic filter in JIRA. It is still available using JQL in advanced filter, but not all users are capable of creating their own advanced filter.

I hope the problem is described clearly. If not, let me know and I will provide more information.
Maybe there is another way we may achieve our goal which may be articulated as follows:

* We would like to map issues to future larger releases like "Service Release (SR1)" and see "Road Map" with number of planned issues vs fixed issues. as follows:
** Service Release 1 (SR1)
** Service Release 2 (SR2)

Thank you very much in advance
fields.summary: "Fix Version/s" vs "Road Map"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we have configured JIRA to a read-only Crowd user directory and Crowd is connected to a delegated LDAP , the synchronization of users should happen when they try to login, however, this does not happen and the users which are logging in for the first time are not allowed to login until the directory is synchronized by the synchronizing service which runs at the specified interval of time (default 60 mins) in the directory Configuration in JIRA.

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.3.15 and Crowd 2.7.0
JIRA 6.4.12 and Crowd 2.8.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Crowd with delegated LDAP directory
# Configure JIRA as an application in Crowd , refer [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Adding+an+Application]
# Configure Crowd user directory in JIRA as a read-only directory
# Try to login with a user(newly created user) in the CROWD directory which is allowed to login to JIRA

Refer the attached screencast [^ newuser.ogv]

h3. Expected Results
Newly created user should be able to login for the first time

h3. Actual Results
User is not able to login unless the directory is synchronized
 
h3. Notes
This seems to be a regression from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26882
fields.summary: JIRA with delegated LDAP directory connected through crowd does not auto synchronize user details and groups on first login

{code}

h3. Actual Results
The issue is transitions to the Done status.
